revised_title: Crystallographic Analysis and Deformation of Protocatechuic Acid Monohydrate Crystals
tldr: The article discusses the crystallographic aspects of protocatechuic acid monohydrate crystals and their spontaneous deformation. The author confirms Wood's observations and reports crystal structure analyses for three of the four polymorphs. The deformation is due to progressive gliding of lattice planes, and the deformations are topotaxic, meaning that the layer arrangement is preserved but not the complete three-dimensional orientation.
